Package Assignment

Class MenuList

  • java.lang.Object
    • Assignment.MenuList
  • public class MenuList
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for holding all the full objects of items and promotional sets in the menu.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MenuList()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Food> getAllFood()
      Returns an ArrayList containing all the items and promotional sets within this MenuList
      CategoryKeyMap getCategoryKeyMap()
      Returns the CategoryKeyMap of this MenuList
      int getCategorySize​(java.lang.String type)
      Returns the number of items within a given category
      Food getFood​(java.lang.String id)
      Returns the food object corresponding to the food ID string
      java.lang.String getNewFoodId​(java.lang.String type)
      Returns a new item ID string starting that is available within this MenuList with the character associated to the inputted category.
      void hideFood​(java.lang.String id)
      Hides the food within this MenuList from displaying in the Menu display and make it to not able to be ordered.
      void insertFood​(Food food_insert)
      Insert a new food into this MenuList.
      java.lang.Boolean isFood​(java.lang.String id)
      Returns whether the given ID corresponds to an item or a promotional set within this MenuList or not.

      Returns whether the given ID corresponds to an item within this MenuList or not.

      Returns whether the given ID corresponds to a promotional set within this MenuList or not.

      Prints all the item and promotional set categories within this MenuList

      Prints all the food items within this MenuList

    • Method Detail

      • printCategoryList

        public void printCategoryList()
        Prints all the item and promotional set categories within this MenuList

      • getCategorySize

        public int getCategorySize​(java.lang.String type)
        Returns the number of items within a given category
        Parameters:
        type - the category type
        Returns:
        the number of items

      • getCategoryKeyMap

        public CategoryKeyMap getCategoryKeyMap()
        Returns the CategoryKeyMap of this MenuList
        Returns:
        the CategoryKeyMap

      • getNewFoodId

        public java.lang.String getNewFoodId​(java.lang.String type)
        Returns a new item ID string starting that is available within this MenuList with the character associated to the inputted category. This ID can be used as an index for a new item.
        Parameters:
        type - the full category name that the new ID string would be generated based on
        Returns:
        the new item ID string

      • getFood

        public Food getFood​(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the food object corresponding to the food ID string
        Parameters:
        id - the food ID string
        Returns:
        the food corresponding to the food ID string

      • getAllFood

        public java.util.ArrayList<Food> getAllFood()
        Returns an ArrayList containing all the items and promotional sets within this MenuList
        Returns:
        the ArrayList with all the items and promotional sets

      • insertFood

        public void insertFood​(Food food_insert)
        Insert a new food into this MenuList. A valid item ID for this MenuList must have already been set for the object before insertion.
        Parameters:
        food_insert - the food to be inserted

      • removeFood

        public void removeFood​(java.lang.String id)
        Removes a food within this MenuList. This will remove the data for the food entirely and could not be used as reference later on when calculating previous sales data if the food has been ordered before.
        Parameters:
        id - the item ID of the item to be removed

      • hideFood

        public void hideFood​(java.lang.String id)
        Hides the food within this MenuList from displaying in the Menu display and make it to not able to be ordered.
        Parameters:
        id - the item ID of the item to be hidden

      • printFoods

        public void printFoods​(java.lang.String type,
                       java.lang.Boolean showUnavailable)
        Prints all the food items within a given category
        Parameters:
        type - the category type
        showUnavailable - an option for whether to print unavailable food items

      • printFoods

        public void printFoods​(java.lang.Boolean showPromoSet,
                       java.lang.Boolean showUnavailable)
        Prints all the food items within this MenuList
        Parameters:
        showPromoSet - an option for whether to print promotional sets
        showUnavailable - an option for whether to print unavailable food items

      • isItem

        public java.lang.Boolean isItem​(java.lang.String id)
        Returns whether the given ID corresponds to an item within this MenuList or not. Will also return as false if the given ID cannot be found within this MenuList.
        Parameters:
        id - the given ID
        Returns:
        true if there exists an item with this given ID, false otherwise

      • isPromoSet

        public java.lang.Boolean isPromoSet​(java.lang.String id)
        Returns whether the given ID corresponds to a promotional set within this MenuList or not. Will also return as false if the given ID cannot be found within this MenuList.
        Parameters:
        id - the given ID
        Returns:
        true if there exists a promotional set with this given ID, false otherwise

      • isFood

        public java.lang.Boolean isFood​(java.lang.String id)
        Returns whether the given ID corresponds to an item or a promotional set within this MenuList or not.
        Parameters:
        id - the given ID
        Returns:
        true if there exists an item or a promotional set with this given ID, false otherwise
